snippet: Mr. Tohti, who was jailed after speaking out against repression in his native Xinjiang, has been depicted by Beijing as promoting separatism....
abstract: Uighur intellectual Ilham Tohti wins 2016 Martin Ennals Foundation award, referred to as Nobel of human rights prizes, for his two decades working to ease tensions between Uighurs and Han Chinese and promoting respect for Uighur culture; honor comes two years after Chinese authorities sentenced Tohti to life in prison.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Tohti, who was jailed after speaking out against repression in his native Xinjiang, has been depicted by Beijing as promoting separatism.

headline.main: Ilham Tohti, Uighur Scholar in Chinese Prison, Is Given Human Rights Award
headline.print_headline: Uighur Scholar in Chinese Prison Is Given a Rights Award

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
